title: 109_s3676
content: The Congressional Accountability Act of 1995 is amended to include whistleblower protection rules for legislative branch employees. This amendment adds section 207, which outlines rights and protections under whistleblower protection rules. The Congressional Accountability Act of 1995 is amended to include whistleblower protection rules for legislative branch employees, outlined in section 207. No employing office can take personnel action against a covered employee for disclosing information on violations of laws or public health and safety risks. The Congressional Accountability Act of 1995 includes whistleblower protection rules for legislative branch employees, allowing disclosure of information on violations of laws or mismanagement without fear of retaliation. The Congressional Accountability Act of 1995 provides whistleblower protection for legislative branch employees who report gross mismanagement, waste of funds, abuse of authority, or dangers to public health or safety. The Act defines terms like "covered employee" and "employing office" and outlines remedies for violations. The Congressional Accountability Act of 1995 provides whistleblower protection for legislative branch employees reporting misconduct. The Act outlines remedies for violations, including regulations issued by the Board to implement the rights and protections under this section. The Congressional Accountability Act of 1995 provides whistleblower protection for legislative branch employees reporting misconduct, with technical and conforming amendments made to the table of contents for part A of Title II. The Congressional Accountability Act of 1995 now includes whistleblower protection rights and protections under Section 2302(b)(8) of title 5, United States Code.
